summary: This is an FBI 302 interview summary of Nicole Hesse, who worked for Jeffrey Epstein around 2001-2003, primarily house-sitting at his New York residence when he and Ghislaine Maxwell were absent. She describes her duties, interactions with Maxwell and the housekeeper, and observations about phone calls and visitors, including girls calling for Epstein. The interview includes her recognition of her handwriting on message pads shown by the AUSA.

persons.name: Nicole Hesse
persons.context: Interviewed by FBI/AUSA about her work for Jeffrey Epstein around 2001-2003. She house-sat, answered phones, and interacted with housekeepers. Recognized her handwriting on message pads shown during the interview.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Owner of the New York residence where Nicole Hesse worked. Described as rarely present, but Hesse recalls him arriving once with 'lots of girls and bags.' She initially thought he might be a 'good guy' based on the housekeeper's description.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Hired Nicole Hesse, trained her on phone procedures, and showed her a closet, instructing her not to let girls wear her clothes. Hesse perceived Maxwell and Epstein as boyfriend and girlfriend with a 'weird relationship.'

persons.name: Francine
persons.context: Housekeeper at Epstein's New York residence. Hesse helped her fold towels. Francine told Hesse that Epstein was 'really healthy' and didn't do drugs or drink.

connections.description: Hesse felt they were 'obviously boyfriend and girlfriend' and noted they had a 'weird relationship,' partly due to Maxwell's instruction about not letting girls wear her clothes.
Hesse was hired to house-sit and ensure housekeepers did not steal. She met Epstein only about 1-2 times.
Maxwell called and hired Hesse, trained her on phone procedures, and showed her a closet with specific instructions about girls not wearing her clothes.
Hesse helped Francine fold towels while house-sitting. They worked together at the Epstein residence.

events.title: Girls calling for Epstein
events.description: Hesse recalls answering phone calls from girls asking if Epstein was in town, with one girl sounding 'frantic.' She also recalls Epstein arriving at the house once 'with lots of girls and bags.'
